skill.name: hypogenic
skill.description: Automated hypothesis generation and testing using large language models. Use this skill when generating scientific hypotheses from datasets, combining literature insights with empirical data, testing hypotheses against observational data, or conducting systematic hypothesis exploration for research discovery in domains like deception detection, AI content detection, mental health analysis, or other empirical research tasks.

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation and configuration template skill with no executable code. This skill provides instructions for using the external hypogenic Python package via pip. No file system access, network operations, or code execution capabilities are contained in the skill files themselves.

content.value_statement: Manual hypothesis generation is slow and limited by human creativity. Hypogenic automates systematic hypothesis generation and testing using LLMs, combining data-driven patterns with literature insights for accelerated scientific discovery.
actual_capabilities: Generate 10-20+ testable hypotheses from observational datasets
Combine literature insights with empirical data patterns
Test hypotheses against test data with voting and ensemble methods
Support OpenAI, Anthropic, and local LLM providers
Iterative refinement based on validation performance
Process research papers for literature-integrated hypothesis generation
limitations: Requires external hypogenic Python package installation
Needs API keys for OpenAI or Anthropic models
Manual dataset preparation in specific JSON format required
GROBID setup needed for literature PDF processing

use_cases.title: Accelerate literature review
use_cases.description: Generate testable hypotheses from datasets and validate against existing research papers

use_cases.title: Pattern discovery
use_cases.description: Automatically discover hypotheses from data patterns without existing theoretical frameworks

use_cases.title: Deception detection
use_cases.description: Systematically test hypotheses about AI-generated content and behavioral patterns

prompt_templates.title: Basic hypothesis request
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate 20 testable hypotheses from this observational dataset about patterns that distinguish between classes. Focus on specific, measurable characteristics.

prompt_templates.title: Literature integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Based on these research paper insights and observational data patterns, generate hypotheses that combine theoretical foundations with empirical observations.

prompt_templates.title: Hypothesis refinement
prompt_templates.prompt: These hypotheses performed poorly on challenging examples. Generate improved versions that address the failures while maintaining the core insight.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-hypothesis testing
prompt_templates.prompt: Run inference using multiple hypotheses from the hypothesis bank. Report which hypotheses best explain each test sample and their combined predictions.

output_examples.input: Generate hypotheses for detecting AI-generated text vs human writing
output: Hypothesis 1: AI-generated text contains fewer grammatical errors than human writing
Hypothesis 2: AI text shows higher formality consistency across sentences
Hypothesis 3: Human text contains more personal pronouns and emotional language
Hypothesis 4: AI-generated content has more uniform sentence length distribution

best_practices: Prepare datasets in the required JSON format with text features and labels
Start with 20 hypotheses and increase based on validation performance
Use Redis caching to reduce API costs for iterative experiments
Customize extract_label function for domain-specific LLM output parsing
anti_patterns: Using the same hypothesis bank without iterative refinement
Neglecting to validate hypotheses against a holdout test set
Ignoring literature integration when theoretical frameworks exist
Failing to customize prompt templates for your specific domain

faq.question: Which LLM providers are supported?
faq.answer: OpenAI (GPT-4, GPT-3.5-turbo), Anthropic (Claude models), and local LLMs via compatible APIs.

faq.question: How many hypotheses should I generate?
faq.answer: Start with 20 hypotheses. The framework supports iterative refinement to replace poorly-performing ones.

faq.question: Can I use local models instead of APIs?
faq.answer: Yes, Hypogenic supports local LLMs through compatible API interfaces for reduced costs.

faq.question: Is my data sent to external servers?
faq.answer: Data is sent to your configured LLM API provider. Configure which provider to use in config.yaml.

faq.question: Why are my hypotheses too generic?
faq.answer: Refine prompt templates in config.yaml to request more specific, testable hypotheses with clear measurable characteristics.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual hypothesis generation?
faq.answer: Studies show 8-15% improvement over few-shot and literature-only baselines with 80-84% hypothesis diversity.
